ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 8 hours
5h
5hours
3 hours
6 hours
8 hours
2hrs for taking the course and 3hrs for doing homework (if there is)
4 hours.
1 hour
6hr

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Too little coursework
The amount of homework is good, the teaching is overall excellent. The weakness is sometimes the theoratical part of the method is not covered.
Nice structure, Maybe more details into the proof and theorem.
interesting materials covered could add more topics on machine learning methods could provide R codes and packages of the methods covered
it had both theory and applied part. this course is very important for biostat students

The course is well organized. However, as the only nonparametric course provided in the department, I feel some important topics were not covered. There were only five homeworks and the first two were too easy.
Strength: Detailed lecture notes. Weakness: More demo and application/codes of each concept will be much more helpful.
Great!
great
I don't understand why the nonparametric course contains a lot of parametric topics.
good
it is a good course overall. combined theory and practice use
introduced lots of useful non-parametric topics some concepts are difficult to follow and understand

It covers most of essential topics in nonparametric statistics. However, I fell like this course might need to pay more attention to rigorous part of some topics to get student a better understanding.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Heping Zhang  Great.
Instructor: Heping Zhang  He is good at teaching and he is very nice.
Instructor: Heping Zhang  Great Professor.
Instructor: Heping Zhang  He enjoys his teaching.
Instructor: Heping Zhang  Professor very energetic and passionate about subject. Spent much time on small details and not enough time on big picture.
Instructor: Heping Zhang  interesting teaching style; able to explain the materials very clearly
Instructor: Heping Zhang  He is very nice and experienced
Instructor: Heping Zhang  Heping is a talented and enthusiastic professional. Hes very responsive to questions.
Instructor: Heping Zhang  Strength: Detailed lecture notes. Weakness: More demo and application/codes of each concept will be much more helpful.
Instructor: Heping Zhang  Prof. Zhang is excellent.
Instructor: Heping Zhang  responsible instructor
Instructor: Heping Zhang  Obviously, professor Zhang did not spend much time on teaching.
Instructor: Heping Zhang  good
Instructor: Heping Zhang  A very responsible professor. The slides are well-organized. It will be better if the content could be more detailed.
Instructor: Heping Zhang  He is very nice and kind.
Instructor: Heping Zhang  responsible and humorous does not give help on homework, some homework questions are arbitrary

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I am afraid that you still do not know how to use nonparametric methods in real-life problems after taking this course.
This course I will definitely recommend to any biostat student. It is helpful.
Would recommend.

Since the course opens per 2 years, so I have to take it in the first year. But it is a little hard for me. The nonparametric algorithm is very important in actual data analysis. I recommend the course!
Worthwhile to gain background, but won't learn much skill.
Yes
this course is good. I will recommend it.
I would recommend it to other students. Topics covered in the course were important. However, I wish that we could go into more depth.
Strength: Detailed lecture notes. Weakness: More demo and application/codes of each concept will be much more helpful.
Great!
I would recommend
No, I would not.
good
The course is good. I will recoomend
introduced a set non-parametric methods applicable to the field of biology yes, it deepened my understanding of lots of concepts
